The patient has been diagnosed with peritoneal cancer and has responded to chemotherapy, but surgery was not performed. Regular follow-up scans every six months are crucial for monitoring the disease's progression or stability. The recent CT scan of the chest, abdomen, and pelvis with contrast shows no focal lung lesions, no pleural or pericardial effusion, and no central pulmonary embolism.
